titleInfo.title: Letter, David L. Jones in Nashville, Tenn. to Anna Jones in Allegheny City, Pa, 1865 June 03

mods.abstract: 1865, June 3 David L. Jones in Nashville, Tenn., to his wife Anna M. Jones in Allegheny City, Pa. Familiarizes her with his well spent daily routine in the camp, in comparison to the other soldiers' laziness and the resulting consequences. Complains that any attempt at establishing a routine is often interrupted by constant relocation. Mentions that the barracks is presently located near the former 1800 acre spread of Rebel General Cheatham and his three sons. He describes in detail the landscape, architecture, and not so obvious religious affiliation, which his regiment shares with hundreds of soldiers of no fewer than seven other regiments in the area. Having no idea when he'll return home, assures her of his faithfulness and reminds her not to be so lenient with the boys.
